titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Keeler Brothers magazine prospectus 1979.011
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-29 13:47:18 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: A one-page printed 1876 prospectus for publication of the periodical "Once-a-Week" to "aid in the promotion of the welfare and growth of the Village of Roslyn, Long Island, New York." The prospectus is attributed to the Keeler Brothers.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1979.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: Roslyn is a village in the Town of North Hempstead on the North Shore of Long Island. Once-A- Week or The Roslyn Tablet was published there by the Keeler Brothers (William and P.L.A.O. Keeler). Vol. I was published elsewhere and is unrelated to Roslyn. Vol. II commenced with the issue for Oct. 12, 1876, the first Roslyn issue, and continued (Vol. III) through the issue for Oct. 19, 1877, at which time publication was suspended.

list.head: Sources:
list.item: Roslyn Landmark Society. "Annual House Tour Guide." 1979. Accessed March 29, 2024. https://www.roslynlandmarks.org/img/profiles/files/House%20Tour%20Booklets_PDF/1979%2019TH%20ANNUAL%20HOUSE%20TOUR%20GUIDE.pdf
"The Newspapers of North Hempstead." In History of Queens County with Illustrations, Portraits & Sketches of Prominent Families and Individuals. New York: W.W. Munsell & Co.; 1882. pp. 409-468.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Keeler Brothers magazine prospectus, 1876, 1979.011; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A one-page printed 1876 prospectus for publication of the periodical "Once-a-Week" to "aid in the promotion of the welfare and growth of the Village of Roslyn, Long Island, New York." The prospectus is attributed to the Keeler Brothers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
